page.title: 09Animal Life-river and field
page.content: There is a great deal of animal life dependent on the River Windrush. Birds such as Mallards, Moorhens, Coots and Little Grebes abound. A few families of swans live in our area, one pair have produced 9 or 10 cygnets over the last few years in spite of the worry of lead poisoning due to shot left by anglers. There are a few mink along the river and they are now hunted. An occasional fox is seen and these are also hunted. Hedgehogs are plentiful, judging by the numbers that we see squashed on the roads. Water rats live on the river banks and brown rats are here too. They are a problem around the Grain Stores. There are wild cats and a few badgers in the woods, also grey squirrels. Occasionally a heron or a kingfisher is seen catching fish. Mice and moles are small problems but myxomatosis is killing off the rabbits.
